messages.content: What is the purpose of the queueSequence node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes?
The queueSequence node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes uses rgthree's fast_group_muter and bookmark nodes, along with the pyautogui library, to simulate clicks and hotkeys, and run groups in sequence.
What should be noted when using the queueSequence node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes?

When using the queueSequence node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes, one should not change the hotkeys and zoom ratios of the first bookmark, and the first bookmark and fast_group_muter should be stacked on top of each other with fixed relative positions.
How can the center of the first group in the fast_group_muter node be measured?
After queueing once, the center of the first group in the fast_group_muter node can be measured using the ctrl+/ key combination, and the coordinates will be printed out in the console.
What does the totalRounds parameter control in the queueSequence node?
In the queueSequence node, the totalRounds parameter controls the number of rounds the sequence will run.
How is the numOfQueues parameter related to the number of groups in fast_group_muter?
In general, the numOfQueues parameter, which represents the number of groups in each sequence, corresponds to the number of groups in fast_group_muter.
What is the purpose of the booleanJumper node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes?
The booleanJumper node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes receives a boolean value and jumps to the appropriate node based on the definition in the node, activating and queuing it.
How does the screenShot node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes capture screenshots?

The screenShot node in ComfyUI_SillyNodes captures screenshots by converting the 'trigger_field' to the input and linking an INT node. Regardless of the INT input from the previous node, it takes a full screenshot and outputs an image.
